The fact is that the Canaanites dyed the fabrics with a unique composition, which was made from the slime of local shells of the Murex genus. That's why this product was in great demand.

The Canaanite settlement existed for about 500 years, and in the XV century B.C., it came under the authority of the Egyptian pharaohs. After 300 years, the Philistines from Greece took over the territory. Ashdod was their major city. These ancient people lived here until the VI century B.C. Then the city repeatedly changed hands. Both Assyrians and Persians visited it. In the IV century B.C., the area was conquered by Alexander of Macedon, who founded a Greek city on it.

In 147 BC, Ashdod was taken and attached to Judea during the Jewish revolt against the Ptolemaic Empire. The Romans, led by commander Pompey, conquered the area in the I century B.C. During their rule, Ashdod became an important port city.

In 66 A.D., during the Roman-Jewish collision, Ashdod was destroyed and, after that, lost its importance and remained a small settlement for about a thousand years.

In the IX-X centuries, a small Arab town, Isdud, was founded there. It had existed for a long time, right up to the end of the British Mandate, when the State of Israel was proclaimed based on the Partition Plan of Palestine (May 15, 1948).

After these events, Ashdod already became an Israeli city that was actively being rebuilt and strengthened. In the 50s, repatriates from Morocco and immigrants from Egypt came here. It was mainly the working class who were employed in constructing the power plant and in the craft workshops.

In 1959, Ashdod received local council status; in 1968, it was officially named a city.

In 1989, the mass repatriation of Jews to Israel from the USSR and other CIS countries began. Over the past ten years, over 100 thousand people have arrived in Ashdod.

In 1990, thanks to archaeological research, evidence of 22 cultural layers, from the Stone Age to the Greek period, was found in this area. No wonder, today tourists from all over the world come here to see with their own eyes the real ancient city.

description.en: One of the oldest cities in the world, the name of which is translated from Hebrew as "City of Peace". It is an open-air museum, where every stone breathes history and time stops. A city that was captured 80 times and where political wars continue to this day. The city in which the events described in the Bible took place. The Holy City, which gathers pilgrims from all over the world and hears thousands of prayers at the Wailing Wall every day. Even if you have never been to Israel, you probably know for sure that this magical city is Jerusalem. And you should definitely visit it!

long_description.en:
The modern inhabitants of Jerusalem come from different national and ethnic groups. Many of them had been living in the city for a long time as pilgrims or immigrants but had gradually developed into almost native inhabitants. Constant wars and changes of rulers from different countries and nationalities played a role in shaping the local population of Jerusalem.

According to the 2015 census, almost 64% of Jerusalem residents are Jews, and about 33% are Arabs. It should be noted, however, that the group of Arabs can be divided into Muslims (96 percent) and Christians (4 percent). In addition, about 0.6% of Armenians live in Jerusalem, and slightly more than 1% are of other nationalities. Another fact about the local population of the capital concerns age — over 35 percent of Jerusalem residents is under 18 years of age.

description.en: In this huge metropolis, which is contrary to Kipling’s statement, the West is intertwined with the East. Here, wealth coexists with poverty, modernity — with antiquity, Catholic churches — with mosques and pagodas, huge supermarkets — with colorful bazaars. There you can find modern skyscrapers on one side of the street, and colonial mansions on the other. Some residents of Mumbai develop software and monitor exchange rates, whereas others manually wash other people’s linen, passing on their difficult profession by inheritance. You can’t describe this city better than “Mumbai is a city of contrasts.”

long_description.en:
Mumbai is one of the most densely populated cities on the planet (it holds second place after Manila). Based on the ethnic composition, about half of the local population are Marathi, whereas approximately 25% are Gujarati.

Marathi is considered the official language, but, in fact, a peculiar dialect is spoken in the city, which is a mixture of Hindi, Marathi, and English. Interestingly, there are much fewer women in Mumbai than men — a ratio of about 8 to 10. When it comes to religion, almost 70% of the population are Hindus, 17% are Muslims, although Christians and Buddhists live in this city, as well.

description.en: Jaipur is a fabulous city, the capital of the Indian state of Rajasthan, and its largest metropolis. It is located in the east of the Aravalli Range, in the most picturesque place — the Malwa Plateau. There are two large rivers, the Banganga and the Banas. The rectangular arrangement of nine blocks is unusual in its layout. The city is surrounded by a high wall, which protects residents from enemies and wild beasts. It is also called the "Pink City," as all facades of houses in Jaipur are painted in this color, the color of hospitality. Jaipur is also the home of jewelry art with incredible historical sites and gorgeous architecture. There are many picturesque parks, ensembles of castles and fortresses, museums, Hindu shrines, and many other attractions, the beauty of which attracts tourists from around the world.

long_description.en:
Jaipur translates from Hindi as "the city of victory." The history of its foundation is connected with the Rajput Maharaja Jai Singh II, who was the ancestor of the founder of the Kachhwaha clan in the XII century. The capital of the clan was Amber. A fort was built on its site, which can still be seen today.

The city grew larger and richer. The problem of accommodating the growing population and the acute water shortage forced the Maharaja to start building a new city, Jaipur, in 1727. Jai Singh invited the architect Vidyadhar Bhattacharya to design it. The new Jaipur had precise symmetry, and in 1876, it was painted pink to welcome the Prince of Wales.

Since 1956, Jaipur has been the capital of the state of Rajasthan. Cotton, glass, and pottery industries are well developed here, and there are whole neighborhoods of artisans. Jaipur is the world's largest center for processing semi-precious stones.

description.en: Bangalore is India's third-largest city, its intellectual core. Every Indian boy dreams of being here, having learned IT skills beforehand. It's a metropolis that tears up all the patterns. Bangalore welcomes its guests with wide avenues, mirror-like office, and shopping centers, surprises with cleanliness, and abundance of greenery. And only noise and traffic jams remind us of usual India.

long_description.en:
Bangalore was founded in 1537 when the Vijayanagara Empire's vassal built an earthen fort and the Nandi Temple here. According to a legend, this happened after a traveler who had lost his way and had not had food for several days was sheltered and fed with beans by a village girl. The settlement was named Bangalore, which stands for "Boiled Beans." In 1638, the Sultanate of Bijapur captured the city, and in 1687, the Mongols came and sold the settlement to the king of the Mysore dynasty, Chikka Devaraja Wodeyar.

As a result of the Anglo-Masurian War, Bangalore became an official British residence in 1804.

In 1898, the city suffered severely from the bubonic plague, and its population declined significantly.

In 1906, Bangalore became the first city in India to have electricity.

In 2006, Bangalore was officially renamed Bengaluru. However, the name has not caught on and is rarely used.

Currently, Bangalore is the center of information technology in India, so it is also called Silicon Valley. It is an industrial city where engineering, aerospace, electronics, military, and telecommunication products are actively developing.

description.en: This incredible city is a real knot of contradictions. Varanasi is a contrasting combination of luxury and poverty, magnificent architecture, and mud on the narrow streets of poor neighborhoods. The city used to be so beautiful that the supreme god Shiva himself and his wife Parvati wished to settle there. It remained just as charmingly beautiful today. And at the same time, Varanasi is a place of death because thousands of pilgrims come here to die. The funeral fires have been burning here for centuries without fading out. It's believed that after dying in this city, the worshippers of Shiva will leave the wheel of samsara and will never be reborn in another body again.

long_description.en:
Officially, Varanasi is about 3,000 years old. But Indian legends mention that it is more than five thousand years old. According to various versions, Shiva either created this city or simply noticed its amazing beauty and wished to remain in it. But the Hindu chronicles state that the world's creation began with Varanasi.

During the lifetime of the Buddha, who was born about 567 B.C., Varanasi became the capital of Kashi. At that time, this ancient Indian kingdom was the center of Vedic and secular education, although military affairs were also highly regarded here. Throughout its history, Kashi was considered one of the most powerful states in northern India.

In the Middle Ages, the city survived the Muslim conquests (XI century), the protectorate of the Delhi Sultanate (XIII-XVI centuries), and the Mongol raids (XVI-XVII centuries).

In 1775, the region came under the British protectorate, and Varanasi received its second name, Benares. The owners of the East India Company earned a lot from the export of perfumes, muslin, silk, and ivory products for which the city was famous.

Only in the early XX century did the kingdom of Kashi gain independence and become an Indian state, but without jurisdiction over Varanasi.

Now the city is one of the largest religious centers in India. Devotees of Shiva come here to die, and it is here that it is customary to worship the Ganges, the incarnation goddess of the great river. Varanasi is a shrine for Buddhists because it was here that Shakyamuni Buddha began to preach his teachings. There are also many Muslims, who make up about a third of the population, and Jainists, who flock to the city from all over India. There are Christian temples, too, which have been preserved in India since the time of European presence.

description.en: Agra is located in the north of India, on the bank of the Yamuna River. This city is deservedly considered one of the most beautiful in the country. It is where the Taj Mahal, a dazzling gem of architecture recognized as the Seventh Wonder of the World, is situated. Agra has no beaches or oceanfront. But there are many beautiful architectural monuments and majestic palaces built during the reign of the Great Moguls.

long_description.en:
Agra was founded in the XV century and, for some time, existed as a small settlement. In 1426 Babur, the founder of the Mughal dynasty conquered it. He built the first fortifications here and started the city's prosperity era. In the second half of the XVI century, Agra, which became the empire's capital, had more than half a million inhabitants. In 1658 the Padishah of Aurangzeb decided to move the capital to Aurangabad. From this point onward, the city's development came to a halt.

In the XVIII century, Agra was destroyed by the Pashtuns, Persians, and Jats, who periodically raided the region. In 1784 a Maratha army captured the city, which remained there for almost 20 years.

In the early XIX century, the region was occupied by the British Empire. The British forces drove out the Marathas and turned Agra into a major trading center. Industrial enterprises began to develop in the city, and railroads connected it with Calcutta, Delhi, and Benares.

In 1857 a revolt of the sepoys (Indian mercenary soldiers) broke out in many regions of India. The British abandoned the city, taking up defenses in an ancient fortress on the right bank of the Yamuna River. Soon a large army unit came to their aid, and the rebels were defeated.

British India gained independence only in 1947. Agra continued to develop as an industrial center.

The city is now famous for its jewelers and leather artisans, but tourists are attracted here by other things - unique monuments left over from the reign of the Mongol emperors.

description.en: New Delhi is the capital of India, which can be easily called the most nontypical in the world. The thing is that de-jure it is a district of the city of Delhi. But de facto — the seat of the government, beautiful architecture, many tourist attractions, and prosperity of this district have long ago made it independent. The tourists who have already visited India will notice the difference between the capital and other cities. It is much cleaner, with unusual architecture prevailing, and the locals have a lot of European traditions and habits. Bright, modern, and incredibly vibrant New Delhi will bring out powerful emotions and will not go unnoticed.

long_description.en:
The locals are very friendly and always ready to help a tourist. But you should bear in mind that a stranger or even a policeman will ask for a reward.

New Delhi residents have good writing skills in English, but they speak very little English or have an accent that makes it almost impossible to understand something.

description.en: Kolkata is a contrasting city, which is also known as a shocking place. It is a part of the British Empire, which is reborn from the ashes at the moment. On its streets, you have the opportunity to see an unexpected combination of luxury cars with rickshaws. In turn, dilapidated Victorian mansions peacefully coexist with modern high-rise buildings, whereas barefoot kids run around sparkling shop windows of jewelry stores. On the one hand, this city can be associated with dirt, poverty, and desolation; on the other hand, it is the city of the greatest scientific discoveries, architectural masterpieces, and boundless mercy. Kolkata, which is still widely known as Calcutta in spite of the fact that it was officially renamed, amazes its tourists with unusual combinations of attractions. It is certainly worth seeing this city with your own eyes.

long_description.en:
According to local legends, Kolkata or formerly Calcutta, owes its appearance to Kali herself, the great and terrible goddess, from whose pinky toe the settlement called Kolikata, which means "the land of goddess Kali," grew up.

The fishing village on the bank of the Hooghly River, one of the branches of the Ganges, did not stand out from hundreds of their kind until the late XVII century. It was then that the first Brits, employees of the East India Company, who traded with Bengal, came to the land. One of them, Job Charnock, is considered the founder of Kolkata, which became the capital of British India.

The XIX century was the city's true heyday. Magnificent buildings appeared splendid parks were laid out, cobblestone roads were built, and unseen lampposts were erected in the streets. Kolkata became a center of culture and education. The decision to divide Bengal, however, provoked widespread discontent.

The situation in the city gradually heated up, and the British relocated the capital to Delhi in 1911. Refugees from East Bengal literally flooded already overcrowded Calcutta. Its streets, where hundreds of thousands of people have lived and often died, turned the city into a symbol of poverty and decay. The new wave of refugees that swept in after the 1971 Indo-Pakistani war exacerbated the situation.

In 2001, Calcutta officially became Kolkata.

Now the state capital of West Bengal has overcome a long depression, and its economy is one of the fastest-growing in India.

description.en: Aqaba is the only resort in Jordan. It is located on the coast of the Gulf of Aqaba, which is the northern spur of the Red Sea. The city is adjacent to the border with Israel, neighboring Eilat, and a few kilometers south of the Jordanian border with Saudi Arabia. Tourists in Aqaba are attracted primarily by the warm and clear waters of the Red Sea, as well as its colorful reefs with their amazing inhabitants. The beach line here stretches for almost 20 km. Yes, some of the free beaches are not impressive because they are visited by residents (and Aqaba has 140,000 inhabitants). But there are also more than enough comfortable beaches. And the "Tala Bay" complex, located on the southern outskirts of the city, will satisfy the most demanding fans of beach recreation. From Aqaba, you can easily reach such iconic places as ancient Petra and the picturesque Wadi Rum desert.

long_description.en:
The climate here is hot. In summer, the daytime temperature usually exceeds +35°C, and often the thermometer in the shade shows above +40°C. In winter, the daytime temperature is +21°C-22°C, but the nights are cool (+8°C-10°C). In addition, in December and January, there are strong winds. The water temperature in the Red Sea is always high. Even in winter, it does not fall below +21°C. So you can swim at this time of year, but because of the strong wind coming out of the water, it is not very pleasant.
        In summer, the water temperature is even overly warm; for example, in August - above +28°C. In other words, you can not cool down from the day's heat in the sea, and the hot wind does not bring freshness. So the best time to come to Aqaba is spring and fall, more precisely - April and the first half of May, October, and the first half of November.

description.en: Amman is the capital of Jordan, a country that keeps the breath of God. This city is built of white limestone and, at noon, blinds with its whiteness. Like hundreds of years ago, bread is still baked in the street, and there is a mullah's voice from the minaret five times a day calling Muslims to prayer. It has no gloss or sophistication but its own charm. Here you can see the king in a shop or in a street diner, where he eats the food of his people. On his streets, you can still find women in traditional clothes, but every year, more and more of them bravely open their faces and hair and prefer work to housekeeping and child-rearing. Locals adore their Queen Rania, a style icon throughout the world. Her portraits can be seen everywhere. Amman is a modern Arab city where the beautiful oriental flavor has not been lost.

long_description.en: As of 2015, Amman was home to about 1.8 million people. Muslim Arabs mostly populate it. Ethnic groups represented in the city are Palestinians, Iraqis, Circassians, and Armenians.

description.en: The mysterious Tian Shan mountains inspire to create something majestic and beautiful. It seems that this is why, in the foothill hollow of Trans-Ili Alatau, a proud and majestic city, named after Almaty, was born. The loss of the status of Kazakhstan's capital has not changed the cultural-historical significance and magnificent original atmosphere of this place. The garden-city, surrounded by the vigilant guards, in the form of snowy Tian Shan firs, pierces the soul with landscapes of incredible beauty. Big Almaty Lake, raised in the mountains like wine in a glass to the height of more than two thousand meters above sea level, attracts guests and locals with inexplicable force. Flowing down from the rocks, the life-giving Bolshaya and Malaya Almatinka bring to the city an abundance of mountain freshness and crystal-clear filling of all city water systems. From the highest point, Kok Tobe Peak, you can see a wakening city shrouded in mountain smoke, feel the breath of rocks, be saturated with clean and fresh air, and fall in love with the southern capital of Kazakhstan for life! Modern Almaty is the economic, financial, and cultural hub of all Central Asia. It always welcomes real fans of active recreation, cultural entertainment, sports, and ecological tourism.

long_description.en:
The number of people living in the megalopolis of Almaty exceeds one and a half million, much more than some European capitals. As for the national composition, it can quite rightly be called diverse. The main part, of course, is Kazakhs (more than half of the population), the second place belongs to the Russians, Uighurs have slightly more than five percent, and Tatars, Ukrainians, Koreans, and other ethnic groups are represented in approximately equal numbers - within one percent of the entire population.
        Residents of the southern capital have an excellent command of the Russian language and are always friendly and curious about tourists.

description.en: Phnom Penh is the capital of Cambodia, where the Tonle Sap River flows into the Mekong and gives part of its waters to the Bassac River. The ancient history and the difficult fate of the whole country, which survived the tragedy of civil wars and genocide half a century ago, are reflected in the appearance of this city. Phnom Penh buildings of the colonial period are adjacent to ancient monuments and modern high-rise buildings. And the splendor of the central streets are side by side with the beggarly appearance of remote side streets. Of course, the city attracts tourists primarily by the ancient Khmer temples, the richest collection of the National Museum and the magnificent Royal Palace. But there is also a special flavor in it, which is difficult to convey in words.

Sihanoukville is a resort that is just beginning its path to popularity. It is called the pearl of Cambodia. People come here for a calm and measured rest, for solitude and relaxation. Here they enjoy picturesque nature, explore uninhabited islands, admire Buddhist temples. Sihanoukville is younger than other Asian resorts, but this does not make it worse. On the contrary, many travelers choose it precisely because it has not yet been spoiled by numerous tourists.

Kuwait City is a modern metropolis, where the motives of ancient Arabic fairy tales can be seen through the glass and concrete. Oil flows in its veins, its towers and minarets pierce the sky, the gold of sand surrounds its streets, and the waters of the Persian Gulf wash the quays. Its European roots are closely intertwined with Arab traditions. Kuwait City, or "City," as the locals call it, will find a place for everyone, surprise, mesmerize, and remind about forgotten legends. This city is relatively young, but also very wise. Its wisdom hides in huge halls of libraries and numerous museums, chairs of research institutes. And the And the eyes of this city are focused on the future.

Vientiane is a small exotic capital of the small South Asian country of Laos. The city is situated on the Mekong River banks and borders with the neighboring state of Thailand. The high concentration of authentic Buddhist temples, leisurely life of non-industrial, and sparsely populated city predispose to peace and harmony. Vientiane is the best place for meditations. The locals themselves joke that it is possible to listen to rice growing here — so calm and quiet is Vientiane. The tranquility and provinciality of the Lao capital impress and entices. Tourists are looking for exotics that do not imply entourage and ostentation. The exotics of Vientiane consist of a relaxed, ethnic atmosphere, lack of global industrialization, and total urbanization. Moreover, it is the national flavor of each inhabitant not for the sake of pathos, but because of the quality of life. If all this is part of the travelers' plans, then the capital of Laos, Vientiane, is waiting for you and will show a completely unexpected side of Asia.

Beirut is one of the oldest cities of the East, the capital of Lebanon, its largest city, and the sea gates of the country. It lies on a peninsula washed by the Mediterranean Sea. In Beirut, the Muslim religion organically stand side by side with the Christian religion, ancient monuments coexist with modern skyscrapers, as well as a warm sea does with snowy mountain peaks. This ancient Middle Eastern city, which survived the destructive war at the end of the 20th century, directly combines luxury and poverty. It is also called the city of Phoenix. Destroyed seven times by the conquerors, it was reborn from the ashes again and again. Today, it looks like a small Europe, with elegant historical architectural buildings, fashionable clubs, restaurants, hotels, and the region's largest casino.

long_description.en:
The capital of Lebanon can be considered a combination of various civilizations, world cultures, and religions. It seems like you were asked for a date in one place, but at different times. More than half of the population professes Islam, but the second most popular religion in the country is Christianity of various types and faiths.

In the past, the city was a French colony, which is why so many people speak French. Moreover, young people also learn English, even though the state language is Arabic. Therefore, the street names are written in two languages ​​- Arabic and French, less often — English.

description.en: Male is one of the smallest capitals in the world. The main city of the Republic of Maldives is located on the southern coast of the North Male Atoll. “Royal Island” and “City of Sultans” are considered the main names of Male, which characterize the beautiful city. An exotic paradise in the Indian Ocean captivates the hearts of tourists with magnificent palaces that wonderfully combine with high skyscrapers.

Ulan-Bator is a city of contrast where Soviet and modern buildings stand side by side with traditional white yurtas on the background of magnificent mountain landscapes. The coldest city on Earth is located in the Tuul River valley, near the Bogd Khan Mountain. It is a center of a mixing of cultures of Europe and Asia. It is called “the island of civilization” among endless northern deserts, where nature remains pristine, fierce nomads get warm in yurts, and wild camels walk on rugged prairies. Ulan-Bator fascinates and attracts those who would like to discover something exotic, become part of the wilderness, feel the spirit of nomads, and explore such a mysterious and untrodden by tourists Mongolia.

long_description.en: Residents of Ulaanbaatar are half the population of Mongolia. The city is home to 1,405,000 people. If we turn to history, back in 1919, on this territory (then still Urga) lived 100 thousand people. Only 30 thousand were Mongolians, and the other 70 thousand were Chinese. Now Ulaanbaatar could be considered a city of one nation. 85% of the natives are Mongolians, about 20 thousand Russians, and a few more Chinese. The city, like the state as a whole, is considered mono-ethnic.

description.en: Yangon… It seems that time here was flowing discretely, cutting some kind of a double cake. When walking around the city, you constantly walk from one historical period to another, from one cultural layer to another. Of course, Yangon is a city of Buddha and fantastic temples built in his honor. You should come here to enjoy the incredible splendor of Shwedagon, Chaungtha, Botataung, and Sule pagodas.

As a city widely known due to its majestic temple complexes, palaces, ancient gods, and colors affected by the dust of centuries, Kathmandu has not changed its appearance in spite of the fact that its history is based on numerous years, centuries, and even millennia. It is a place where Buddhism and Hinduism are combined. Simultaneously, the development of modern civilization only adds noise and fuss to its streets. In turn, cars slightly disturb the sacred cows and muffle the melodic chime of ritual bells. Even natural disasters, which periodically affect the ancient city, can not wipe it off the face of the Earth. In fact, people have always been taking appropriate measures to restore the destroyed shrines. Nowadays, Kathmandu suffers from the terrible wounds inflicted by the last earthquake. Nevertheless, it does not break the spirit of its inhabitants. Life goes on; the city welcomes new guests, as it has a lot of things that can surprise and delight.

Muscat, the capital of Oman, is a beautiful man-made oasis on the shores of the Gulf of Oman, surrounded by mountains. The city of sandy beaches, eastern traditions, and magnificent monuments of history is considered one of the most beautiful capitals of the Arab world. Nowadays, the local old quarters harmoniously coexist with modern business centers. In turn, people can hear not only Arabic speech, but also English, German, Dutch, and many other languages on the streets of this city. The picturesque eastern city captivates with its special atmosphere from the first minutes, whereas subsequent acquaintance with Muscat gives a lot of positive emotions and unforgettable impressions.

long_description.en: According to 2015 data, the city is home to more than 1.5 million people. The majority of residents are Arabs by nationality. Persians, mulattoes, Baloch people, Indians, Asians, and other nationalities also live here.

description.en: On the Potvarsky plateau, surrounded by mountain ranges, tourists can find the capital of Pakistan — Islamabad. A large modern metropolis, where the architecture harmoniously combines eastern and European traditions, is considered one of the most beautiful cities in South Asia. Minarets of beautiful mosques, magnificent ancient fortresses, lush parks, gardens, and traditional markets attract tourists from all over the world to this young capital. Islamabad is an amazing combination of Asian and European cultures, which can impress any tourist.

long_description.en: According to the 2017 census, the city is home to more than two million people. Mostly Punjabis, Pashtuns, Baloch, Saraikis, Sindhis, and Muhajirs live here.

description.en: Tashkent is a modern metropolitan city that managed to preserve the charm of oriental culture. The city attracts tourists by its unique atmosphere of Central Asia, diversity of architectural forms, and amazing interlacing of ancient and modern. Magnificent mosque domes, bright mosaics, cool fountains — Tashkent offers all this to his guests.

long_description.en: More than 2.5 million people live in Tashkent. The bulk of the inhabitants is Uzbeks - about 63%. There is also a large Russian diaspora - up to 20% of the population of Tashkent. Representatives of other nationalities also live in the city: Tatars, Koreans, Tajiks, and Uigurs.

description.en: If you are ever told that a city with beautiful nature, a deep historical past, fabulous castles, and a colossal cultural heritage is just a dream and a fantasy — do not believe it! It really exists and can be found among the rocks and deserts of Uzbekistan, in the valley of the Zeravshan River — Samarkand. There are many labyrinths-gardens, amazing brightly-glazed castles, and mosques, beautiful squares on the background of rocky landscapes. All this creates the illusion of an oasis in the middle of the desert, a valuable diamond among the stone rocks. It seems that somewhere here, under one of the beautiful sky-emerald domes, an amazing wizard from the fabulous country of Oz should live.

long_description.en:
Samarkand is the second city in Uzbekistan (after Tashkent) by territory and population. It is home to about 120 thousand people. Because of all the historical twists and turns, the national composition of the city is very diverse. The lion's share is, of course, Uzbeks and Tajiks; Persians (Iranians) and Russians are among the largest ethnic minorities, with Azerbaijanis, Armenians, Koreans, Tatars, Jews, Ukrainians, Belarusians, Poles, Germans, Roma, and Arabs slightly less among these groups.

Representatives of all nationalities have learned to get along with each other and treat all nations and nationalities with restraint and tolerance. Samarkand citizens are religious, conservative, and friendly, waiting and welcoming tourists.

description.en: Located on the island of Luzon, on the Pacific Ocean, the capital of the Philippines can be considered one of the most significant cities in Southeast Asia. Manila is a sophisticated, naive, aristocratic, and simple tourist destination. The modern metropolis, recognized as the most densely populated city on the planet, remembers numerous centuries and eras. However, it is still easy to find a quiet place in order to relax, enjoy the peace and tranquility of various beautiful gardens and parks with exotic flowers. Temples of different faiths add a special highlight to this city, making it incredibly atmospheric. The capital of the Philippines can teach people how to stay strong and love life: after being burnt and ruined, it was still reborn better than ever. Warmed by the bright rays of the sultry tropical sun, the city is surrounded by picturesque Pacific nature. Moreover, it fascinates with its harmony and compatibility of incompatible monuments of architecture, catchy colors, and strong energy of life. Once you decide to go to the Philippines, you can find yourself in one of the most unusual places in the world, as well as get a flurry of emotions, unforgettable impressions, and the opportunity to visit the eternal summer.

long_description.en:
The modern inhabitants of the Philippines capital are descendants of settlers who lived in the area before the Spanish arrived. They farmed the land and were proficient with firearms. Until the XVI century, about 6,000 people had lived here. The Spanish, English, and American conquistadors all contributed to the city's demographics. The population decreased catastrophically during World War II. Japanese soldiers massacred many local civilians.

Today, the situation has changed dramatically. Modern Manila is the most densely populated city in the world. It has a high birth rate, which is not affected by natural and economic disasters. It is the largest educational center. Therefore, many young people live here during the school year.

Many residents of the capital work in industrial enterprises, widely and diversely represented in the metropolis. They are smiling and friendly. In their free time, they love to hang out at the markets and wander through the numerous shopping malls. Manila residents inherited their zest for life and optimism from their ancestors, undefeated by war and disasters.

description.en: Cebu is the oldest city in the Philippines. It is located on the eastern shore of the island of the same name. It is believed that the city was founded in the place where the great traveler Magellan, who discovered the Philippines, first landed on the shore. It was from Cebu that the spread of Christianity and European civilization on the islands began. The city can be described as an open-air museum, as it includes a variety of attractions. For instance, the Magellan’s Cross is usually perceived as the main symbol of the city. Residents of the city claim that any disease can be cured by touching this element. Also, the tourists are often interested in the Minor Basilica of the Holy Child of Cebu and Fort San Pedro — the oldest and smallest one in the country. In addition to its main purpose, San Pedro used to serve the functions of prison, hospital, and school. In turn, nowadays, it serves the function of a museum. Independence Square and Casa Gorordo Museum are an integral part of the main city attractions as well.

Megalopolis Toronto is spread on the bank of Lake Ontario. It’s a city of ultra-modern skyscrapers, ancient mansions, exuberant parks, and sports arenas. Toronto was founded by the representatives of many nationalities and cultures who were in search of a better life far away from home. Dynamic Toronto is one of the largest megalopolises in the world. It’s listed in Guinness World Records as the most multicultural city. Futuristic constructions, snow-white yachts, rocking on the waves of the blue bay, museums and concert halls, nightclubs, and bars - Toronto prepared plenty of surprises for every tourist.

long_description.en: Almost three million people live in the city. The total population of the Great Toronto metropolitan area reaches six million. It’s one of the most multi-national megalopolises on the planet. Over 47% of the citizens living in the administrative center of Ontario were born in foreign countries. The Indians are the largest diaspora in Toronto. They conclude 9.6% of the immigrants. Many Chinese, Italians, and Filipinos also live in the city. Around 2.5% are immigrants from the former Soviet Union.

description.en: The capital of Canada, Ottawa, is located in the east of the picturesque province of Ontario, on the banks of the river of the same name. It's a beautiful city that perfectly combines coziness, comfort, business, and cultural life. It combines a harmonious blend of contemporary and historic architecture, measured serenity amid gorgeous scenery, and the fast-paced rhythm of metropolitan life. Each season in Ottawa has its own way of beauty and a wealth of exciting events and activities. The Ice Figure Festival takes place in winter, the Tulip Festival in spring, and the theater and concert seasons open in September. In this city, it is impossible to get bored or remain indifferent when something is always happening, and there is something to admire. Ottawa's vastness and scale, yet lack of pathos and kitsch, give it special energy, with an atmosphere of harmony and peace. The air is filled with the scent of pine, lush greenery, and delicate flowers. The city is buried in the emerald splendor of parks, squares, and elegant boulevards. It is particularly good to walk, dream, do sports, and study here. Once you've been here, you'll definitely want to come back.

long_description.en:
About a quarter of today's Ottawa residents were born outside of the Canadian state. The indigenous inhabitants of Canadian lands were Indians, who lived mainly by hunting and fishing; some engaged in agriculture. The tribes existed in isolation and had little contact with each other. The languages of communication were Athabaskan and Algonquian. Indians worshipped the spirits of nature and tried to live in harmony with it.

Ottawa of the XXI century is a city with a young population. Almost half of its residents are under the age of 35. They are the descendants of Europeans who came here in the last two hundred years. The capital boasts the highest level of education in Canada — more than half of its citizens have a degree, diploma, or certificate. Ottawa is a city with many different levels of educational institutions. Each year, the population of the capital grows significantly due to the students who come here from all over the world. Residents of the city are friendly and always welcome visitors.

description.en: Montreal is Canada's second-largest town and the biggest city of Quebec province. The British colonial style constructions are adjacent here to the architecture of New France and the masterpieces of modern urban planning, and neo-Gothic style is harmoniously combined with the Baroque. The air of the New World absorbed the aroma of old Europe. This city reminds of many things and looks nothing alike. Europeans can see America in it, Americans — Europe. And also, Montreal is one of the most comfortable cities in the world, and you feel it as soon as you get here.

geography.en: Montreal is located on the island of the same name, where St. Lawrence and Ottawa rivers meet. However, Greater Montreal includes several other administratively independent cities located around the island of Montreal. Historically, Francophones live mostly in the city's eastern part, and Anglophones are in the western part. The conventional boundary is Boulevard Saint-Laurent. For tourists, the most attractive is Old Montreal, where there are many attractions and the district of Saint-Denis, which will remind you of France and Paris. Little Italy is also interesting (next to the Jean-Talon market). There are many cafes with Italian cuisine.The Chinatown is also colorful. You can get acquainted with the oriental flavor and taste Chinese cuisine there.

long_description.en: While Montreal itself has about two million inhabitants, Greater Montreal has almost four million. It is a multicultural city. About 65% of the population prefers French as their language of communication, and another 17% prefer English. French is the city's official language. But most residents have no trouble communicating in two languages.

description.en: Quebec is a fabulous ancient European city among the dense forests of America. It is nestled by the Saint Lawrence River, combining several cultures at once. Nearly 500 years ago, French colonists arrived in a harsh and unexplored land and founded a small town here with its own culture and architecture. They managed to keep their unique charm in the cobblestone streets and the sound of merci in restaurants and noisy bars. Here you can still plunge into the magic trance of the ancient tribe of Huron, and the markets sell French delicacies. The gallant, sophisticated, and romantic Quebec is the continent's only fortified city north of Mexico, which will make you fall in love at first sight.

Vancouver stands magnificently on the bank of a marvelous harbor, surrounded by tall green mountains. This city was proclaimed to be the best city on the planet three times! Besides, it’s the most fast-growing city in Canada. It astonishingly combines modern comfort and proximity to nature. Here, the cultures of many nations are intertwined. One can sail and ski from the mountain on the same day only in Vancouver. This incredibly green and cozy city is renowned for its parks, nature reserves, wonderful beaches and museums that have been loved by tourists a long time ago.

long_description.en:
According to the last population census in 2016, the number of inhabitants is more than 600 thousand citizens. The Greater Vancouver agglomeration is the third in size in the country. More than 2 million people live here.

The city is multinational and its ethnical population is extremely diverse. The majority of citizens in Vancouver are immigrants from England, China, Italy, Ukraine, India, Vietnam, Cambodia, Japanese, Greece, Korea, the Philippines. Almost 52% of citizens don’t consider English to be their native language.

description.en: Richmond is a wonderful and extremely dynamic city in Canada. Located in the District of British Columbia, it is part of the Greater Vancouver metropolitan area. It is particularly located on one of the islands of the Fraser River — Lulu. In turn, the western border of the city is the Strait of Georgia. Richmond impresses city guests with the unbelievable nature, its diversity, and the unusual combination of riparian vegetation with considerable greenery of the ocean coast. A huge Richmond Nature Park, the cleanest air, wild birds, and small animals can be considered excellent companions for hiking and cycling in these areas. The city also carefully preserves historical buildings and architectural monuments. You can attend numerous local festivals for children and adults every year, as there is a variety of playgrounds, outdoor pools, and parks that offer the opportunity to go on a picnic. Moreover, the city has a lot of cozy restaurants, cafes, as well as the fish market and port. In spring and autumn, migratory birds stop on the Pacific coast on their way from the Arctic to South America and vice versa. It is a magnificent and unforgettable sight!

long_description.en:
The native population of Richmond, as well as of the whole of Canada, are North American Indian tribes, which were driven out from their lands by the arriving Europeans. For numerous years, they were required to live on reservations, although this experience helped them preserve their culture and identity, thereby saving them from assimilation.

The modern population of Richmond is multinational, as representatives of different ethnic groups and religions coexist perfectly on the territory of this cozy Canadian town. The majority of them moved here from China, Hong Kong, and Taiwan.

The Japanese were among the first individuals to arrive at these areas. In spite of the fact that numerous their generations have been living here for decades, their manners and self-identification are still preserved. Therefore, it provides this city with a unique atmosphere.

Recently, the number of Russian-speaking population has been growing in Richmond. In many schools of the city, you can meet an average of 2-5 Russian-speaking students in the classroom. Besides, it was decided to open two stores with the so-called "Russian" products.

The city is considered quite young because the average age of its inhabitants is 39 years old; most of them are couples. Furthermore, every year the number of local population increases. Richmond can be regarded as a city of fishermen and lovers of fish or seafood, which are sold in abundance. Also, Richmond inhabitants are recognized as the most slender population group in Canada, which is why the number of people suffering from overweight is low in the city. An active and healthy lifestyle plays a considerable role for the citizens; hence a whole range of wellness programs are implemented here.

Richmond residents love picnics, family parties, children's competitions, and any collective events. They are organized, cheerful, friendly, and open in the expression of emotions. Local citizens will always answer your questions, help to address the problems, and smile warmly.

description.en: The vast majority of tourists who travel in Canada surely come to Calgary for a few days. It is located in the southern part of Alberta province, among the foothills and prairies. Two large rivers flow through the city — the Bow and its tributary Elbow, and there are several large lakes nearby. Calgary is rightfully considered to be the sports and cultural center of Canada. It is famous for its modern architecture, attractions, and vibrant cultural events. The city is renowned for its many skyscrapers, and the two most unusual ones — Scotiabank Saddledome and Calgary Tower — have become its official symbol. Calgary's parks are joined together in the largest system for hiking, biking, and roller-skating in North America. The city is also often called "North Nashville" as Canada's largest country music center.

long_description.en:
The first European came to Calgary in 1787. It was then inhabited by various tribes of North American Indians who did not build cities but wandered after moving flocks of bison. The first settlement on this site was Fort Brisebois, founded in 1875. There was a unit of mounted police controlling the fur-trade and whiskey trade. A year later, the fort was renamed to Calgary by Colonel James Macleod. There are several versions of its origins, but the most plausible is that in Gaelic, the expression cala gheallaidh means "pasture on the shore", and McLeod was undoubtedly Scottish.

In 1883, the Canadian Pacific Railroad station was opened in Calgary, and the development of the fort, which quickly became a city, went at a rapid pace. The government began renting out numerous pastures for a symbolic fee, and Calgary became one of the country's largest cattle breeding and agricultural centers. In addition, until 1914, all the settlers had been given free plots of land for building houses, which had rapidly increased the population of the city.

Oil was first discovered in Calgary in 1902, but there was little of it and did not have much impact on the economy. But in 1947, a geological exploration came across huge deposits, which later gave a powerful boost to the city's economy (in 1973, the oil crisis sharply increased the price of "black gold"). The oil boom allowed the start of the construction of numerous skyscrapers that flooded the business center of Calgary, pushing out the classic sandstone buildings. The sharp drop in oil prices put the Calgary economy in a deplorable state, but the situation gradually stabilized and returned to normal by 1990.

Calgary became a large multinational center, and hosting the Winter Olympics in 1988 brought it worldwide fame. Nowadays, high-tech industries and large investments in tourism contribute to its development. Every year, more than three million tourists come to the city to relax at ski resorts, walk around the city, and participate in cultural events, which are held here quite often. According to the Economist Intelligence Unit, Calgary has become the 5th most comfortable city in the world, so the visitors feel free and comfortable here.

description.en: In the north of the Great Prairies, along the North Saskatchewan River banks, lies the Canadian city of Edmonton. The administrative center of Alberta is considered one of the cultural capitals of the country. Once a tiny village of the pioneers of western and northern Canada, today it is a magnificent modern city. Tourists here will find unique museums, luxurious parks, beautiful temples, and cozy restaurants with amazing food.

long_description.en:
The first Europeans appeared on the land of today's Edmonton in the middle of the XVIII century. It was the Englishman Anthony Henday's exploring party. Fort Edmonton was founded at the very end of the eighteenth century by the Hudson's Bay Trading Company. The manager of the company was originally from Edmonton, England. It was his initiative to give the fort the same name. The settlement grew rapidly. The fur trade flourished here, and the first settlers departed from here for new lands.

At the end of the XIX century, a railroad was built through the fort. In 1892, Edmonton was declared a city. In another 14 years, the province of Alberta was formed with Edmonton as its center.

After 1914, there was a sharp decline in the economy of the city. The collapse of real estate prices caused it.

The discovery of large oil fields in the late 1940s led to a new heyday for Edmonton. The economic boom continued until the second half of the 1980s. But after the collapse of oil prices, the city began to decline again.

The beginning of the new millennium brought another economic boom to Edmonton. The city gradually became the economic and cultural center of the region.

description.en: Halifax is a strategically important Canadian port city on the Atlantic coast. This is the place where Titanic passengers were rescued, and many victims of the shipwreck found peace. The town has an excellent geographical location in the southeast of the country. Its natural harbor is one of the largest in the world. The port of Halifax is a large trade zone, from which regular cargo shipments take place. The city hosts the main naval base of Canada, where naval ships have settled. The settlement was founded by the British in 1749 on the site of the Mi'kmaq Indian tribe. Halifax is the oldest English-speaking Canadian city. Picturesque sea landscapes and many attractions, including a maritime museum, an old cemetery, fortress, the oldest park in Canada, attract a lot of tourists every year.

Tulum is a trendy Mexican resort on the Caribbean coast, located on the Yucatan Peninsula, near Playa del Carmen (Quintana Roo). The water here delights with a clear azure, in which you want to dive with your head. The beaches attract with their fine white sand on which you can lie for 24 hours. And it' s so beautiful everywhere that you don't want to leave. Right off the coast are the ruins of ancient Mayan buildings. Archaeological monuments are perfectly-preserved here and attract many tourists every year. Vacation in this part of the world is amazing with its variety: swimming, diving, bungee riding, walking in the tropical forests, night discos, watching the life of exotic animals. Many people who have been here are sure that this is what a corner of paradise looks like. And they're probably not far from the truth.

long_description.en:
The exact date of Tulum's origin is unknown. Scientists name only approximate pointers — XII-XIII centuries. Such assumptions are based on the fact that the first mention of the area can be found in the records of the conquistador Juan Diaz (1518). The city ruins were described in detail in 1843. It was done by the travelers John Lloyd Stephens and Frederick Catherwood in the book "Incidents of Travel in Yucatan".

In ancient times, Tulum was the only seaport for representatives of the civilization through which the Mayans exported cotton, rubber, and salt to Guatemala. This fact helped the city to avoid the decline of nearby settlements when the Spanish conquerors landed in Yucatan (1517). In contrast, the beginning of the XVI century is considered to be the time of flourishing for Tulum. Remaining a maritime fortress, it became a major trading center on the Caribbean coast. All trade by sea, from Yucatan to Honduras, was conducted through it.

The exploration of the territory was continued between 1913 and 1924 by the American archaeologist Sylvanus Morley and scientists from the Carnegie Institution for Science. They confirmed that the emergence of the city should be attributed to the year 1200. At the same time, according to them, Tulum stopped to exist after the XVI century.

Thus, there is a real ancient city in front of us, as if it was frozen more than 400 years ago. With untouched nature and clean beaches right by the Caribbean Sea. This fact has allowed developing Tulum as a popular resort. Today, recreation here has all the advantages one can dream of.

description.en: Snow-white beaches, which are 22 km long, unique nature of the tropics, turquoise waters of the legendary Caribbean Sea, made the city one of the five best resorts in the world. Tourists will find not only magnificent beaches, hotels with SPA centers, various sea entertainments, but also architectural monuments of ancient Maya, and many natural sights. Families with children will find beaches with calm water at the top of the spit. Extreme lovers will enjoy the thrill of the open sea with an impressive surf.

long_description.en: According to the 2010 census, more than 600 thousand people live in the city. Mexicans prevail among them — about 60% of all residents. The next largest ethnic group is Indian.

description.en: One of the largest megacities on the planet, Mexico City, is located in a picturesque high mountain valley. The city of the mighty ancient civilization of the Aztecs today impresses the imagination with its bright colors and variety of architectural forms and styles. Mexico City is not for nothing called the City of Contrasts. Here, modern skyscrapers neighbor the picturesque colonial houses, and wide well-groomed streets with the slums of the poor. Unique Aztec civilization monuments, majestic cathedrals, lush parks and sanctuaries, entertainment complexes — neither an adult nor a child will be bored in Mexico City.

long_description.en:
According to the census of 2017, more than 9 million people live in the metropolis. The mestizos (descendants of mixed European and Native Indian marriages) make up the majority. Many indigenous people of Mexico live in the city, but most of them are descendants of the Nahuas.

Spaniards, Argentines, French, Lebanese, Americans, Colombians, and Germans compile the majority among immigrants from other countries.

description.en: In the picturesque Atemajac Valley (Mexico) lies the capital of the state of Jalisco — Guadalajara. The cultural center of Mexico, a city with beautiful colonial architecture, has earned another — "Pearl of the West". Due to a large number of luxurious parks and squares, Guadalajara is called the "City of Roses". It is home to the world-famous tequila, Mariachi music, and the national entertainment called "charreada". There is an atmosphere of real Mexico, which is impossible to imagine without salsa and delicious local cuisine.

La Paz is a traditional Mexican town located on the Pacific coast in the state of Southern Baja California. Its name in Spanish means "peace." At first sight, the city can be associated with the sea and endless summer. Golden beaches, white yachts, palm trees, and coastal bars offer the opportunity to enjoy a relaxing vacation. The center of La Paz is Piazza Hardin Velasco. Here you can admire one of the main architectural attractions — the ancient Cathedral Basilica of Our Lady of Peace. In turn, the five-kilometer promenade is usually perceived as a great place for evening walks. At the same time, you can find a variety of souvenir shops and cozy restaurants nearby. When you arrive in La Paz, you should be prepared for adventure. For example, go diving off the island of Isla Espirito Santo, visit the Sierra de la Laguna Biosphere Reserve, sunbathe on the most beautiful beaches, and plunge into the atmosphere of real Mexico.

long_description.en:
According to 2015 data, Acapulco is home to about 880,000 people. The city is the 21st most populous city in Mexico and the most populous in the state of Guerrero. Acapulco is a multicultural city. The indigenous population (Indians by origin) represents no more than 30% of the total population. Most of the settlers are of Spanish descent. In addition, natives of most European countries, including China, Japan, and Africa, live in the city.

The leading religion in the city is Christianity. About 97% of the population is Catholic.

description.en: Tijuana is one of the specific cities not only in Mexico but throughout the world. It is situated in the northwest of the country, and bears the name of the most western town in Latin America. This is an extraordinary city on the border of two states, which has its own laws and policy. People come here to entertain, to live life at ease, and to feel free. The neverending holidays do not stop even for a minute at this place. But if you dig a little deeper, Tijuana will show you modern buildings, fascinating museums, picturesque parks, and delicious food. Do not believe any rumors, come to get acquainted with this amazing city face to face.

long_description.en:
The first inhabitants who set their foot on the territory of present Tijuana were the Kumeyaay. This is proved by the chronicles of missions, who have been to this region. Meanwhile, Europeans discovered the settlement only in 1542, when the Spanish explorer Juan Rodríguez Cabrillo toured the coastline of the area. For the first time to enter the lands of Tijuana became possible in 1769. That lucky man was the Spanish priest and friar of the Franciscan Order Junípero Serra.

The new history of Tijuana began in 1846, when as a result of negotiations during the Mexican-American War, Tijuana gained the international border. The city became a borderline, and in 1864 got its own council and judicial body. The date of the official foundation of the city was July 11, 1889.

According to data within 1900, only 242 citizens lived in the city. The situation rapidly changed in the 20th of the 20 century, when the gambling industry started to develop in Tijuana. The first race track and club were built in 1924, then a tourist center in 1927, and the first casino in 1928.

On October 15th, 1925, Tijuana became the administrative center of the Zaragoza municipality. However, the new name was not established, so in 1927 the Congress of the Union reverted it to Tijuana. In 1952, Baja California received the status of a free Mexican state, and beginning from May 1st, 1954, Tijuana city administration started to work for the first time.

Today, Tijuana is considered one of the fastest growing towns in Mexico. People, attracted to gambling and freedom, usually move here. The other newcomers are the citizens, who wanted to move to America, but didn’t have enough grounds, and were forced to settle in Tijuana. As a result, the city has earned a bad reputation.

Every year, current authorities are actively dealing with the bad image, and gradually turning Tijuana into an interesting and touristic center.

description.en: Orlando is the world capital of entertainment, the city of theme parks, one of the sunniest resorts on the planet. The city is located on the picturesque peninsula of Florida and is famous for its magnificent clean lakes, lush vegetation of parks and gardens, warm climate throughout the year. Orlando's world fame is brought by the world's largest Walt Disney World Park, which attractions and shows are admired by children and adults alike. The amusement-city has prepared a lot of incredible surprises, amazing places, and unforgettable impressions for the flow of guests that is only increasing every year.

long_description.en: According to the data of 2016, almost 300 thousand people lived in the city. More than half of the city residents are white, about 28% are African-Americans, and nearly 4% are Asians. One of the largest Puerto Rican diasporas in the United States lives here.

During the Second Seminole War in 1835-1842, several forts were built in Florida to fight the Indians. After 50 years, they were abandoned, a small settlement was formed on this place, and the region was named New River. Until the early XX century, only a few inhabitants lived in the settlement. But then, with the appearance of the railroad here, it began to develop and grow, becoming a city in 1911. It was named Fort Lauderdale after U.S. Army Major William Lauderdale, who commanded the unit and built the first fort.

During World War II, Fort Lauderdale housed bases for the American Navy and Coast Guard and a pilot training station. After the war ended, many servicemen stayed here, which caused a demographic explosion.

Fort Lauderdale is now not only one of Florida's most visited resorts but also a major yachting center.

description.en: Miami Beach is a resort city in the south of Florida (USA), which has become a synonym of luxury and high-profile long time ago. This is the place where celebrities live and come on vacations, and tourists from all over the world come here to feel like the characters of Hollywood movies. But Miami Beach isn't just about pathos. The city will gladly open its arms in front of its guests, bathe them in the warm ocean, offer delicious cocktails, and charm with its unique atmosphere. Magnificent beaches, bustling parties, high palms, and always tanned people are essential attributes of the resort's life. Miami Beach is the perfect image of a summer you want to dive into.

long_description.en:
The founders of Miami Beach are John Collins and Carl Fisher. Business people from the north-east of the United States saw in the small southern town a great potential to become a world-class resort. They came to Miami Beach at the end of the XIX century to buy a coconut plantation there and start looking for freshwater.

Much of the city changed with the construction of the first wooden Collins bridge in 1913, connecting Miami and Miami Beach. At the time, it was the longest wooden bridge in the world, as well as an important road to provide the urban development project with all the necessary resources. 

Collins sold the land and invested the revenue in the sand and washing up the island. That's how more territory for sale appeared. At this time, Carl Fisher organized a major hotel construction. Hotels and restaurants for the wealthy began to appear in Miami Beach. 

In the 1930s, the city became the winter residence of many mafia members from New York and Chicago, including the famous Al Capone. 

In the 80s, South Beach was a terrible place. Tourists did not show up south of 41st Street at all. Rats were running everywhere, and half the houses were abandoned. 

Things started to change in the 90s. The money gained from selling drugs began to be reinvested in construction. In 20 years, Miami Beach experienced a real rebuilding boom. Whole streets of skyscrapers with magnificent ocean views grew up here. Another factor in the development was the appearance of famous models and actors from around the world in the city. 

Today, Miami Beach remains the most popular resort for rich and famous people.

description.en: A beautiful resort of Tampa is located in the bay of the same name, on the shore of the clear waters of the Gulf of Mexico. The white sand of the beaches and magnificent golf courts attract fans of this sport from all over the world. These are the distinctive features of the resort. The city was able to combine the emerald greenery of wildlife and modern skyscrapers made of glass and concrete in a surprisingly harmonious way. It is ideal for a romantic vacation, as well as for active pastime. Here you can always dive into the fun of a noisy crowd craving for entertainment in numerous centers and clubs. And if you want, you can seclude yourself in absolute silence, broken only by the sound of waves and the chirping of birds.

St Petersburg is rightly called the "The Sunshine City". This is because the sun shines here almost all year round, which is famous for nearly the entire Florida peninsula. The record was 768 days of sunny days in a row. The resort city is located in the southeast of the United States and is named after Russian St. Petersburg. This name was given to it by a Russian immigrant Peter Demens, a nobleman who built a railway station in the settlement on the site of the future city. The city is located on a peninsula, which coast is washed by Tampa Bay and the Gulf of Mexico. Tourists can visit many museums, including the Salvador Dali Museum, with the most extensive collection of works by the Maestro outside the Old Continent. On the pier, there is a small aquarium; you can rent a boat or speedboat, and swim in Tampa Bay to see the dolphins.

Los Angeles is the city where the sun shines 329 days per year. Here people follow the real cult of the body. This is a genuine paradise for the fans of the healthy lifestyle. People all over the world come here in search of their American dream. The Walt Disney World, Hollywood, Walk of Fame, hundreds of museums, and thousands of places that were used as decorations for legendary movies and series. Los Angeles is happy to greet new travelers, and it stays in their hearts forever.

long_description.en:
Los Angeles is the most international city in the USA. All nations of the world live here, and you can hear all the existing languages. Commonly, immigrants from one country group together and dwell in one district. Therefore, Chinese, Mexican, or Russian neighborhoods are typical rather than exceptional.

Angelenos (that’s how the locals call themselves) got used to a calm and regular lifestyle. They are never in s hurry but always in good spirits. Angelenos love surfing, stick to healthy diets, and don’t smoke.

description.en: San Diego is a resort city in the state of California standing on the coast of the Pacific Ocean, near the border with Mexico. It resembles an American dream - unbelievable, but achievable. After all, San Diego is one of the top-25 cities where, according to National Geographic, the happiest people in America live. Many other ratings and lists claim that this is a city of lucky people and one of the best for life. What else can you say after that? The sun shines here 320 days a year, and the weather is always great — without exhausting heat and heavy rains. In San Diego, well-being and measured life prevail, and its ancient parks and modern entertainments compete with the best ones in the world. Wide snow-white beaches, emerald hills and the picturesque bay of La Jolla annually attract lovers of different kinds of recreation.

long_description.en:
According to the statistics, the city of San Diego (updated in 2010) is home to about 1,300,000 people, with more than 3 million in the suburbs.

The racial composition is as follows: 60% of the citizens are white, 29% are Hispanics, 10% are Asians, and 1% are Indians.

The local citizens speak English.

Cahuilla Indians were the first inhabitants of modern Palm Springs, living here in isolation from other cultures for hundreds of years. In 1876, the United States government established the Agua Caliente reservation in a chessboard-shaped format with alternating grounds. In 1877, the South Pacific Railroad construction, which passed through the desert to the Pacific Ocean, was completed. It was allocated land plots not occupied by the Indians.

The first inhabitants, who were not Native Americans, appeared on this territory in 1884. Around the same time, the first hotel, located across the street from Indian baths, was opened here. In them, guests could enjoy the warm water, known for its healing properties.

In 1909, the sanatorium The Desert Inn was opened here, which became a favorite place for millionaires, industrialists, and Hollywood celebrities in the XX century. Also, due to the dry, hot climate, the city began to attract tuberculosis patients, whose condition here has improved significantly.

In the 1930s, American stars became fond of the resort because of its remoteness from the paparazzi and curious journalists who could not get here. Many started buying real estate here and even opening their establishments.

During the Second World War, enterprises and residential buildings were actively constructed in Palm Springs.

After the war, the city continued to build holiday homes, sanatoriums, hotels, as well as elite houses with unusual architectural solutions. Steel and glass were trendy among construction materials.

In the middle of the XX century, more than a dozen golf courses were built in Palm Springs. By the beginning of the next century, their number had increased several times.

In the XXI century, the city continues to be a popular tourist destination in California among golf enthusiasts, as well as those who want to improve their health in the balneological resorts and sunbathe. The city is also popular with connoisseurs of American architecture.

description.en: "If you're alive, San Francisco will keep you from getting bored. If you're dead, San Francisco will bring you back to life" - these words of the American writer William Saroyan describe this city in California in the best way. Amazing San Francisco is built on 42 hills, so an ordinary ride on the local cable car turns into a "roller coaster". San Francisco is a hippie city, a Pacific paradise with luxury beaches, Silicon Valley, Stanford University, Apple Park, parrots on every tree, and innovative cuisine. Its residents make this city by the bay special — weirdos, dreamers, and wandering poets who don't want to go down from the clouds to the ground.

long_description.en: As you explore the districts of San Francisco, it becomes clear that the city has a mixture of various nationalities. For almost 900,000 people, only 44% are white Americans, 31% are Asian, 14% are Hispanics, and 8% are African Americans. San Francisco is a city of immigrants. Nearly 30% of its residents come from California and live here on a regular basis, while others have moved here from other parts of America and various countries.

description.en: Anaheim is a friendly tourist city about 40 km away from Los Angeles. People come here to see a fairy tale, a magnificent Disneyland. The park is constantly expanding and improving, offering more entertainment to children and adults. For example, a themed area Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge was opened in 2019. If not to consider Disneyland Park, you won’t be bored in Anaheim. Festivals, concerts, and festive events are constantly held in the city; and they attract both tourists and the local citizens.

long_description.en:
The city of Anaheim was founded in 1857 by German colonists who looked for a suitable area to grow grapes. For 25 years, the area was the largest wine producer in California, but disease infected the grape vines and other crops – walnuts, lemons, and oranges – soon were planted instead. Fruits and vegetables had become viable cash crops when the Los Angeles region was connected to the continental railroad network in 1887.

In the early 20th century, a large community of Polish emigrants was formed in the city. It consisted of artistic intelligentsia. A famous writer Henryk Sienkiewicz lived there. Helen Street is named after the actress Helena Modjeska. Later Modjeska Park was also named after her.

For a long time, Anaheim was a massive rural community. In 1924, due to political reform, Ku Klux Klan members were elected to the Anaheim City Council. It resulted in serious issues. Far right wing strived to create a law-abiding community with the complete refusal of alcohol; and the German community, that lived according to its traditions, stood against this. After mischief-making and political struggle, members of the KKK were forced to leave the town. The citizens continued to grow fruit and vegetables.

Everything changed when a great dreamer and storyteller Walt Disney decided to build a magical park for children here. He bought 160 acres of land in the suburbs of the city. The first Disneyland was opened to the public on July 17, 1955. Since then, Anaheim has been known all over the world, and its economics refocused on tourism.

Nowadays, almost all well-known American companies have offices and headquarters here. The city constantly hosts national and international conferences.

description.en: Sacramento is the capital of sunny California, west of the United States. It originates from the gold deposits found here and quickly became the most developed city in the state. Sacramento is a peaceful, multifaceted location with a unique history that is very cherished. The capital is famous for its culinary establishments, museums, galleries, and incredibly developed agriculture.

long_description.en:
Sacramento has a population of about 500,000 people. The city is the fourth-largest agglomeration in California after Los Angeles, San Francisco, and San Diego. It has over 2.5 million inhabitants.  The largest percentage of the population is European (47%), followed by Asians (19%) and African-Americans (13%). The remaining races comprise 21 percent, including Native Americans, Hawaiians, islanders, and mestizos. Ten percent of the population of Sacramento identify themselves as members of the LGBT community.

The ratio of men to women is approximately the same — 49% to 51%. The average age of the citizen is 34 years. About 42 percent of Sacramento residents have a university degree.

description.en: When someone mentions Santa Barbara, everyone has an association with the cult series: the main music theme starts playing in the head, and white arches flicker in front of the eyes. But what can Santa Barbara do to surprise travelers, and is it worth going there at all?

long_description.en: Santa Barbara is home to more than 91,000 people: white population compiles 77.5%, 3.9% are Asians, African Americans constitute 1.4%, Native Americans form 0.7%, and other nations are the remaining 16.5%. The average age of the citizens is 38 years; almost half of the population has higher education. There are nearly half a million inhabitants in the Santa Barbara suburb.

description.en: Monterey will definitely be liked by everyone who prefers to relax at the seaside, in quiet and small resorts. It is not only a quiet and cozy tourist destination but also a very beautiful city with numerous ancient architectural monuments and sights. These attractions will give a variety of impressions to those who are tired of lying on the beach. A special Monterey Historical Trail was created for visitors — signs on bright yellow tiles will guide tourists to the most interesting and significant places.

long_description.en:
The city of Monterey was founded by the Spaniards in 1770. For a long time, it has been considered the capital of the state of California, which was part of the Viceroyalty of New Spain. This colony ceased to exist in 1821, after which California became part of Mexico.

In 1818, the city was captured by the Argentine corsairs led by Hippolyte Bouchard. They completely destroyed the port, as well as burned down the governor's residence and all the Spanish buildings. Surprisingly, civilians did not suffer in this case, although they lost all valuables and livestock. After 6 days, the pirates retreated under the onslaught of Spanish soldiers and never returned here.

Monterey became part of the United States in 1846, after the end of the Mexican-American War. This event is considered an important milestone on the path of the accession of the entire state to the United States. Like other cities on this coast, Monterey existed exclusively thanks to fishing, which gradually equated this city with others and led to the loss of the status of the capital.

During World War I, sardine processing plants were opened in the city; they were located next to the Old Fisherman's Wharf. These plants formed the main street called Ocean View Ave, which is now considered one of the most interesting attractions of the city.

In the middle of the last century, fish resources were depleted. In fact, fish catches began to rapidly fall, which ultimately led to the ruin of canneries. Since then, Monterey has become an exclusively tourist resort. Tremendously popular as a clean, complacent, and fabulously beautiful city, it owes its popularity to the novels of the famous American writer John Steinbeck, who described this city in the novels "Sweet Thursday" and "Cannery Row."

description.en: Santa Cruz is in the state of California. This small town is located south of San Francisco on the north side of the coast of Monterey Bay. It was founded back in 1791. The University of California, Santa Cruz, works here. However, real fame and recognition came to the city with 60 thousand inhabitants in 2007. It was at the beginning of August of that year that the owner of one of the local pubs offered to found a new beer festival that would unite the lovers of this foamy beverage all over the world. It was suggested to make this day the International Beer Day. While the first celebration took place only in the Californian city, after some time, it crossed the borders of countries and continents. The beer lovers liked the idea so much that, for example, five years later, the holiday was celebrated in 207 cities in five dozen countries on five continents.

There is a particular pleasure in sitting in a lounge chair, setting shoulders to the sun, and drinking a cocktail "Malibu" in Malibu! The people of this coastal California town know precisely how to enjoy the nature and beauty of the moment. Even the inscription on the welcome sign at the entrance to the city says, "27 miles of scenic views."

long_description.en: According to the latest census survey, Malibu has 12,777 inhabitants. The number of citizens has decreased by 399 over the past 11 years. Malibu's racial composition is not particularly diverse. The vast majority are white (88.61%), Asians make up 3.78%, and Afro-Americans are less than 2%. The average age of city residents is quite high - 51 years. There are 94 men for every 100 women.

description.en: San Antonio annually meets millions of tourists who want to discover its secret. The influence of neighboring Mexico, the presence of Spanish culture, broad avenues, and palm trees like in Los Angeles, a little Italian Venice — one can see various faces of San Antonio. It is a fantastic combination of history and modernity, with many parks and entertainment centers, delicious food, and a unique flavor. San Antonio is charming and does not give a single chance to remain indifferent to this city.

long_description.en: According to the 2018 data, the population of San Antonio is just over 1.5 million.
